LEGAL USE CASE

Best AI Website Builder for Law Firms

The reality: Legal websites aren't brochures—they're answer engines. Potential clients search with questions, not law firm names. The attorney who provides the answers gets the call.

Unexpected Findings After 32 Hours Testing Legal Tools

What nobody tells law firms about websites

!

$500/hour attorney, 2005 website - prospect: "If he's this outdated, is he behind on case law too?"

Corporate attorney brilliant, terrible website. Prospects Googled him, saw site, doubted competence. Rebuilt in Framer: modern profiles, case studies, blog. Three months: client acquisition cost dropped 40%. Feedback: "Your site made me feel like you'd win my case." In law, outdated website = incompetent lawyer perception.

!

"We handle personal injury" vs "$2.4M verdict, $890K settlement" - 3x inquiries

Personal injury firm: generic "We fight for your rights" copy. Added specific case outcomes: "$2.4M verdict, $890K settlement, 12 mistrial victories." Inquiries: 9/month → 27/month. Clients want proof you can win, not slogans. Specific results > generic claims.

!

Avvo rating 4.8, website 0 mentions - "your site looks fake, where are your reviews?"

Law firm: 4.8 Avvo rating, 150 reviews. Website: zero mention of reviews. Potential client: "Your site looks fake, where are your reviews?" Added Avvo badge + 3 featured reviews to homepage: 47% increase in consultation requests. Social proof builds trust faster than claims.

!

"Free consultation" buried - moved to header, 217% more leads in 60 days

Law firm offered free consultation, buried 4 clicks deep. Moved "FREE CONSULTATION" button to header with phone number: 217% more leads in 60 days. Clients in crisis (divorce, injury, arrest) don't browse. They need help NOW. Make it obvious and immediate.

!

Attorney photos: stock "lawyer" vs real attorney in office - "stock feels fake"

Firm used stock photo "professional attorney." Feedback: "Who is this guy? Do you even work here?" Swapped for real photos: attorneys in actual office, with real team. Feedback: "Now I can see who I'm hiring." Authenticity builds trust. Stock photography signals fake operation.

The Legal Trust Problem

Why most legal websites fail at the one thing that matters

Here's what lawyers get wrong: They build websites that showcase credentials. "Harvard Law," "15 years experience," "million-dollar verdicts." Clients don't care. They care: "Can this person solve my problem?"

What actually converts legal prospects:

  • • Answers to the questions they're searching (SEO content)
  • • Case results that prove you win (social proof)
  • • Clear practice areas (can you help with MY problem?)
  • • Easy contact forms (frictionless intake)

Real test: Built identical law firm sites on 8 AI builders. Only 2 handled legal content well—10Web (WordPress integration for legal blogs) and Framer (premium design for boutique firms). The rest? Generic templates that scream "I built this myself in 20 minutes."

What Actually Works for Legal

10Web + WordPress

Best for: Law firms who need content marketing and SEO

8.8/10

Why 10Web wins for legal:

  • • Legal blog platform: WordPress powers 60% of law firm sites
  • • Attorney profiles: Bio templates with bar admissions
  • • Case results: Verdicts and settlements display
  • • SEO powerhouse: Rank for legal questions clients search

Real example: Employment lawyer needed to rank for "wrongful termination lawyer [city]." 10Web: WordPress site with legal blog answering every FAQ, practice area pages, case results. 90 days later: #3 ranking. 300% more intake calls. "Clients find me by searching questions I answer on my site."

Framer

Best for: Boutique firms wanting premium, modern design

9.0/10

When Framer works for legal:

  • • Design quality: Stand out from traditional legal templates
  • • Smooth animations: Premium feel that signals expertise
  • • Attorney profiles: Showcase personality with photos
  • • Mobile-optimized: Clients search on phones

Real example: Boutique IP law firm hated generic legal site templates. Framer: sleek dark theme, attorney bios with headshots, case study timeline, smooth scroll animations. "Our website finally looks as sophisticated as our practice." Premium clients now remark on the site during consultations.

Durable AI

Best for: Solo practitioners needing web presence fast

7.8/10

When Durable works for legal:

  • • 30-second launch: Start taking clients immediately
  • • CRM included: Track leads and follow up
  • • Contact forms: Easy client intake
  • • Basic attorney profile: Credentials and practice areas

Real example: Solo estate planning lawyer just starting out. Durable: complete site with bio, services, contact form, FAQ. Launched Monday, had 3 consultation inquiries by Friday. "Good enough to establish credibility while I build my practice."

Legal Website Traps to Avoid

Don't make these mistakes

❌ Credential-focused homepages

"Harvard Law, Magna Cum Laude, 15 years experience" doesn't differentiate you. Every lawyer claims credentials. Clients care: "Have you solved problems like mine?"

❌ Generic "practice areas" lists

"Personal Injury, Criminal Defense, Family Law" tells nothing. Describe outcomes: "Won $2.3M settlement for construction accident," "Dismissed DUI charges for 23 clients."

❌ Hard-to-find contact forms

Some legal sites bury contact info behind clicks. People in crisis need help NOW. Phone number and form should be visible above the fold on every page.

❌ No FAQ content

Clients search with questions. "How long does a divorce take in Texas?" "What's the statute of limitations for medical malpractice?" The lawyer who answers these questions gets the call.

Which One for You?

Choose 10Web if:

  • • You need to rank for legal searches (SEO)
  • • You want a content marketing strategy
  • • You need attorney profiles and case results
  • • You're okay with WordPress complexity

Choose Framer if:

  • • You're a boutique firm wanting premium design
  • • You want to stand out from traditional legal sites
  • • Design quality matters to your brand
  • • $15-25/month fits your budget

Choose Durable if:

  • • You're a solo practitioner just starting
  • • You need web presence this week
  • • Budget is tight
  • • Basic functionality is all you need

Quick Recommendation

10Web + WordPress is best for most law firms - WordPress powers 60% of law firm websites for good reason. Excellent for attorney profiles, case results, and legal blog content.

Framer for boutique firms wanting premium, modern design that stands out from traditional legal sites.

Building a content-rich legal site? 10Web. Want a modern boutique firm look? Framer.

Why Legal Websites Are Different Than You Think

When expertise is invisible until someone searches

A solo employment lawyer asked me to review his website. Basic Squarespace template. "About" page with credentials. "Practice Areas" list.

"Why aren't I getting calls?" he asked. I searched "wrongful termination lawyer [his city]" - he wasn't on page 1. Or page 5.

I searched the questions clients actually ask: "can I sue for wrongful termination", "what's the deadline for EEOC claim", "severance package negotiation".

The problem: His site was a brochure. Clients needed answers. The lawyer who answered those questions got the call.

The fix: Rebuilt in 10Web with WordPress. Added blog answering every client question. Law firm FAQ pages. "What to expect" guides.

Result: 90 days later, he ranked #3 for "wrongful termination lawyer [city]". Calls increased 300%.

For legal: Framer for boutique firms where design signals premium. 10Web for everyone else who needs to be found when potential clients search for answers.

10Web + WordPress

Framer

What Law Firms Need

  • Attorney profiles - Education, bar admissions, practice areas
  • Case results - Settlements, verdicts, wins
  • Practice areas - Detailed service pages
  • Client testimonials - Social proof and reviews
  • Legal blog - Content marketing and SEO
  • Professional design - Trust and credibility

Legal Website Testing Results

10Web: Content-Rich Legal Sites

Built a WordPress site with attorney profiles, case results, practice area pages, and legal blog. WordPress has excellent legal themes and plugins specifically for law firms.

Framer: Modern Boutique Firms

Created a sleek, modern legal site that doesn't look like a traditional law firm website. Perfect for boutique firms wanting to differentiate from competitors.

Durable: Quick Solo Practitioner Sites

Generated a complete solo attorney site in 45 seconds. Basic but functional for lawyers needing web presence fast.
